jx.jx_en_mean: face to face with someone, especially in an aggressive way

lj.lj_ly: he wheeled round to confront John eyeball to eyeball.
lj.lj_ls: 他突然转过身来，和约翰怒目相对。

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer. informal)stare at someone in a disapproving or angry way, especially with one's eyelids partially lowered
(informal)used to emphasize the extreme degree of an undesirable situation or condition

lj.lj_ly: he's &B{up to} his eyeballs in debt.

entry.def: Your eyeballs are your whole eyes, rather than just the part which can be seen between your eyelids.
If you eyeball someone or something, you stare at them.

example.ex: The guard eyeballed him pretty hard despite his pass.
example.tran: 虽然他有通行证，卫兵还是直勾勾地盯着他。

entry.def: If you are eyeball to eyeball with someone, you are in their presence and involved in a meeting, dispute, or contest with them. You can also talk about having an eyeball to eyeball meeting or confrontation.

example.ex: ...the young thug who stands eyeball-to-eyeball with his victim.
example.tran: 与受害人对峙的那个小混混儿

example.ex: ...proposals that the two armies end their eyeball to eyeball confrontation and withdraw.
example.tran: 两军结束剑拔弩张的对峙、各自撤军的提议

entry.def: You use up to the eyeballs to emphasize that someone is in an undesirable state to a very great degree.

example.ex: ...driving around Los Angeles drugged up to the eyeballs...
example.tran: 吸食大量毒品后在洛杉矶开车闲逛

example.ex: He is out of a job and up to his eyeballs in debt.
example.tran: 他失业了，而且债台高筑。

means.word_mean: 1. the ball-shaped capsule containing the vertebrate eye

Sentence.sentence: There are close to one million nerve fibres that connect the eyeball to the brain, as of yet it is impossible to attach them all in a new person.

sentences.en: There were sharp pains pulsing behind his eyeballs.
sentences.cn: 他的眼球后面有阵阵剧痛。

sentences.en: The two men stood eyeball to eyeball, shouting insults at each other.
sentences.cn: 那两个男人面对面站着互相辱骂。
